revised_title: Environmental Factors Influencing the Yield of Egyptian Cotton
tldr: This study examines the influence of various environmental factors on the yield of Egyptian cotton, including soil fertility, soil texture, soil depth, water supply, weather, climate, and root asphyxiation. The research analyzes data collected from different sites in Egypt and discusses the effects of these factors on the flowering-curve and the final yield of the cotton crop.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Agriculture and Soil Management
